DOC.brief_summary: This study aim determine whether umbilical cord milk improve iron relate health outcome cesarean-delivered infant . Half participant receive umbilical cord milking , half receive routine clinical treatment care .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Umbilical Cord Milking Iron Related Health Outcomes Cesarean-Delivered Infants
DOC.detailed_description: In recent year , several professional organization recommend delayed cord clamp improve placental transfusion newborn bear vaginally base series randomize controlled study . However , similar recommendation available cesarean-delivered infant . Investigators find cesarean-delivered infant vulnerable iron deficiency anemia compare bear vaginally , suggest urgently need find similar anemia prevention strategy infant bear cesarean section . In study , investigator aim test whether umbilical cord milking ( UCM ) , potentially promise strategy cesarean delivery , improve iron relate health outcome cesarean-delivered infant . A total 450 term pregnant woman plan give birth cesarean section enrol two hospital Hunan province randomly assign either UCM group control group . Infants follow 1 , 6 , 12 , 18 month evaluation impact UCM iron deficiency , anemia , well growth developmental status language mental/behavioral outcome .
DOC.criteria: Singleton pregnancy Fullterm pregnancy ( le 37 gestational week ) Cesarean section labor start cesarean section labor start cervix le 3 cm Plan take vaccine receive routine child health care hospital give birth Maternal hypertensive disorder Gestational diabetes macrosomia Gestational diabetes polyhydramnios Maternal severe anemia hemoglobin le 70 g/L Maternal coagulation disorder Fetal growth restriction Major congenital anomaly Hemolytic disease newborn hydrops fetalis Short umbilical cord length ( < 30 cm ) Severe cord placenta abnormality cord prolapse , true knot , placental abruption placenta previa Other condition suitable study judge doctor
